title: Ticket #2288: INVALID_LOG_FILES config variable default might be broken
description:
LIGO was surprised by core files being removed by preen. This is what they stated: 

Unfortunately, I can't find one. It looks like the default behavior of
INVALID_LOG_FILES may have changed for 7.6?

I thought in the past it was sufficient to comment out the following in the
configuration file,

##  What files should condor_preen remove from the log directory?
#INVALID_LOG_FILES      = core

however, with this commented out I see both,

[root@ldas-pcdev1 condor]# condor_config_val INVALID_LOG_FILES
core
[root@ldas-pcdev1 condor]# condor_config_val INVALID_LOG_FILES -schedd
core

Is now necessary to set this to a null string instead of commenting it out (in
order to have PREEN not remove core files)?

Independent of this, does it make sense that condor_config_val without the
-schedd option would report any value at all when there is no uncommented line
in the configuration file?

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# grep INVALID_LOG_FILES /etc/condor/condor_config.local
[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# grep INVALID_LOG_FILES /etc/condor/condor_config
#INVALID_LOG_FILES      = core
